transportAdvice: Avignon's historic centre is compact and very walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot within the city walls. A local bus network serves the wider urban area, and taxis are generally available near the train station and main squares for trips beyond walking distance.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally frosty winter days with periodic rain and the possibility of the cold Mistral wind sweeping through.
Slowly brightening days but still chilly, with lingering winter showers and occasional strong winds.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and longer days, though rain and gusty Mistral winds remain common.
Pleasant spring warmth with blooming landscapes, though showers can still interrupt otherwise sunny days.
Warm and largely sunny with comfortable temperatures, making it an excellent month for sightseeing outdoors.
Hot and dry summer conditions begin, with long sunny days and very little rainfall.
Peak summer heat with intense sunshine and minimal rain; the famous Avignon Festival brings large crowds mid-month.
Continued hot and dry weather with occasional brief thunderstorms providing rare relief from the heat.
Temperatures ease pleasantly into early autumn, with more frequent showers returning toward the end of the month.
Mild and increasingly overcast autumn days with regular rainfall and the return of occasional Mistral winds.
Cool and grey with frequent rain; the city quiets significantly as the main tourist season ends.
Cold winter conditions with short days, periodic rain, and the possibility of frost, though festive Christmas markets add seasonal charm.
